clinical_study.brief_title: Comparative Effectiveness of Bariatric Surgery With PROMs
clinical_study.official_title: Comparative Effectiveness of Metabolic and Bariatric Surgical Procedures Using Patient Reported Outcome Measures (PROMs)

brief_summary.textblock: This qualitative study will identify which domains are most important to metabolic and bariatric surgical patients, their families/partners, and their caregivers and which valid patient-reported outcome measures (PROMs) will best capture this information. Patient and caregiver feedback will be gathered on the local, regional, and national implementation PROMs in the Metabolic and Bariatric Surgery Accreditation and Quality Improvement Program (MBSAQIP) as well as on patient-reported results and data presentation.

primary_outcome.measure: Changes in bariatric related quality of life will be measured using validated patient reported outcome measures
primary_outcome.time_frame: change from pre-operative time point to 1 year post-operative time point

arm_group.description: Focus groups held with pre- and postoperative metabolic and bariatric patients
Focus groups held with pre- and postoperative metabolic and bariatric patient family members or close friends.
Focus groups held with metabolic and bariatric patient health caregivers

criteria.textblock:
Metabolic and Bariatric Patient Population Inclusion criteria
1. Adult metabolic and bariatric patients
1. Preoperative patient with bypass, band, or sleeve surgery scheduled within the next 3 months
2. Postoperative patients who had a primary bypass, band, or sleeve procedure without revision within the last 12 months
2. At least 18 years of age
3. English speaker
4. Willingness to return for 7 focus group events over 4 years
Exclusion criteria
1. Non-English speaking
2. Revised bypass, band or sleeve procedure
3. Immediate family member already enrolled in the study
4. Any postoperative bariatric surgery related complications
Patient Partners (family member or close friend) Population Inclusion criteria
1. Any close family member or friend of a pre- or post-operative bypass, band, or sleeve surgery patient, e.g. spouse, life partner, adult offspring, parent, adult sibling
2. Willingness to return for 2 focus group events
Integrated Caregiver Population Inclusion criteria
1. Any health caregiver having experience working with bariatric patients, e.g. bariatric surgeons, bariatric medical specialists (medical doctor, nurse practitioner, physician's assistant, registered nurse), bariatric psychologists, bariatric dieticians.
2. English speaker
3. Willingness to return for 7 focus group events over 4 years
